author: Lukas Reiter
script:
"""
This script extracts all parameters from in-scope HTTP requests and adds them to the table above
for further analysis.  Thereby, the rows of the table are deduplicated.

Notes: Update the content of the session["filter"] list (see Lines 15+) to limit your analysis
to certain parameter types.
"""
import base64
import traceback
from burp import IParameter
from HTMLParser import HTMLParser

# Do the initial setup
if ref == 1 or "dedup" not in session:
	session["dedup"] = {}
	# TODO: Update to limit analysis to certain parameter types.
	session["filter"] = [
		IParameter.PARAM_URL,
		IParameter.PARAM_BODY,
		IParameter.PARAM_COOKIE,
		IParameter.PARAM_XML,
		IParameter.PARAM_XML_ATTR,
		IParameter.PARAM_MULTIPART_ATTR,
		IParameter.PARAM_JSON
	]
	header = ["Ref.", "Host", "Path", "Content-Length", "Type", "Parameter", "Value", "Reflected", "Value (URL decoded)", "Value (Base64 decoded)", "Status", "Content-Type (Response)"]

# Process only in-scope HTTP requests and responses
if in_scope:
	html_parser = HTMLParser()
	request = message_info.getRequest()
	response = message_info.getResponse()
	request_info = helpers.analyzeRequest(request)

	# Extract relevant information from HTTP response
	if response:
		response_info = helpers.analyzeResponse(response)
		content_type = get_content_type(response_info.getHeaders())
		content_length = get_content_length(response_info.getHeaders())
		status_code = response_info.getStatusCode()
		response_string = unicode(helpers.bytesToString(response), errors="ignore")
		content_type = content_type if content_type else ""
		content_length = content_length if content_length else -1
	else:
		response_string = ""
		content_type = ""
		status_code = ""
		content_length = -1

	# Start analysis
	filter = session["filter"]
	for param in request_info.getParameters():
		if has_stopped():
			break
		elif param.getType() in filter:
			parameter_type = unicode(get_parameter_name(param.getType()), errors="ignore")
			name = unicode(param.getName(), errors="ignore")
			value = unicode(param.getValue(), errors="ignore")
			decoded_value = unicode(html_parser.unescape(helpers.urlDecode(value)), errors='ignore')
			reflected = value in response_string or decoded_value in response_string if value else False
			host_name = unicode(get_hostname(url),  errors="ignore")
			path = unicode(url.getPath(), errors="ignore")
			key = host_name + path + parameter_type + name + value + unicode(content_length) + unicode(reflected, errors="ignore") + content_type + unicode(status_code, errors="ignore")
			url_decoded_value = url_decode(helpers.urlDecode(value))
			try:
				base64_decoded_value = helpers.bytesToString(base64.b64decode(url_decoded_value.lstrip("{\"").lstrip("{'").rstrip("\"}").rstrip("\'}")))
				# We print base64 values that can be fully ASCII decoded. We could also use unicode instead of str.
				base64_decoded_value = unicode(base64_decoded_value)
			except:
				base64_decoded_value = ""
			if key not in session["dedup"]:
				rows.append([ref, host_name, path, content_length, parameter_type, name, value, reflected, url_decoded_value, base64_decoded_value, status_code, content_type])
				session["dedup"][key] = None
name: Parameter - Template Script to Extract Parameter Names and Values from All In-Scope Requests
